rationale: This widely distributed species is known to be common and has therefore been assessed as Least Concern.  Locally, however, it is threatened by invasive species and is also utilised.  Monitoring of this species should be made as it may become more threatened in the future.
assessor: Snoeks, J., Laleye, P. & Contreras-MacBeath, T.
evaluator: Collen, B., Darwall, W., Ram, M. & Smith, K. (SRLI Freshwater Fish Evaluation Workshop)
